fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48227].
  {panel}

Right now points are rounded up when displaying an user's point information.  I know this was how it was in the old answers, but it portrays false information.

Let say you earn some swag at 1500 points.   Starting at 1450 points the user's point value will show 1.5k and he/she might think they earned their swag until they actually look at their real point value.   

If you displayed 1.5k starting at 1500 through 1599, there would be no misrepresentation.

Is there a reason that 1.5k needs to represent 1450 through 1549 points?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48202].
  {panel}

Hi Sam,

Since Atlassian switched Answers to Questions, I miss the old graph which was always pointing upwards. It was just addictive, it makes you want to participate just for the sake of pushing the cursor upwards. It also displayed your inactivity periods, so you didn't want to look like a slacker and you'd make the effort of answering one or two questions every fortnight. Which is an addiction trigger.

Now it's gone. You might want to check what's user engagement since the transition.

Best of luck Sam,
Adrien

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48190].
  {panel}

I was wondering if it would be possible to add two more options (beside the existing Popular, Recent (by question creation date), Unanswered, and My Questions):
Recent Activity – In order based on the latest activity (i.e. creation, answer, comment, or edit) instead of creation like Recent
Number of Answers – In order (descending would be best) based on the number of answers. The Unanswered filter is useful for finding questions with 0 answers, but in some cases a question may be truly unanswered even though it has “answers” posted. For example, Paul just responded to many of the unanswered questions with an answer that was just asking if it still needed to be answered. Because of that, these questions no longer show up in the Unanswered filter. We should probably discourage people from doing that, but with this alternate sort order you could look at questions with only 1 “answer”.
An alternative (or in addition) would be to make Unanswered (or a new filter) include any questions without a “selected” answer regardless of how many “answers” have been posted and encourage people to choose a selected answer when their questions are answered. Most people don’t seem to select an answer currently though so this might not be good enough by itself…might still need the Number of Answers option.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48146].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *Confluence Questions Plugin 2.0.10*.
# Ask a *Question* using the following title:
#* 質問何ですか？
#* 中国语文
# Use the option "*Ask in a space...*".
!create.png|thumbnail!
# *Save* the question.
!cn-jp.png|thumbnail!
# Observe the result.

h3. Expected Behaviour
!expected.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Behaviour
!actual.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Append any characters behind the URL.
For example:
Original URL: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/
Fixed URL 1: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/- 
Fixed URL 2: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/~
Fixed URL 3: http://www.example.com/confluence/display/QUES/questions/4063265/abc

h3. Note
[CQ-1707|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CQ-1707] bug ticket is about Question is not created at all due to Japanese language. As compared to the previous bug ticket raised, question is created successfully but the links are not pointing to the right direction.

fields.summary: Upvote link from email result in exception
Expert of the week reputation is wrong
Font size of question titles is too big
BSB has some search issues
Deleting topics is very painful
Second level nav is indented too far

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48102].
  {panel}

I've noticed that the Leaderboard on Answers isn't working correctly.
For Example: the Weekly Leaderboard for All topics shows Nic Brough at number 1 with 31405 point (I know he's really active but not that active :) )
Here is a screenshot:
!leadersboard-1.jpg!

Also using the topic filters doesn't change the leaderboard all that much, while I do remember from the old Answers Site that especially for Crucible the Leaderboard looked totally different.

Best regards,
Peter
fields.summary: Leaderboard on Atlassian Answers isn't working correctly

fields.description:
The layout on the question view looks a bit sketchy, see screenshot. This happened after an upgrade of Confluence from 5.4.4 to 5.6.3. 

IE 9 is in standard mode, no compatibility mode or anything
fields.summary: Layout issues in Confluence 5.6.3 and IE9

fields.summary: Can't delete topic with 0 questions if someone is watching
RSS feeds aren't working after AAC migration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48095].
  {panel}

When presented with a CQ page which already has 100 individual responses, if a user attempts to add a new response, they are given no warnings or errors.

Upon arriving at the page after submitting the form, they are unable to find their answer on the page. (They can repeat this several times to no avail.)

This presents an obvious issue: Their answer cannot be read and/or considered at any point.

Potential solutions:

1. Remove the 100 cap!
2. Implement pagination.
3. Sort questions by score, low voted questions will naturally fall off the page. (This solution will only work whilst there are less than 100 questions with less than +1 vote.)

The page I was trying to add answers to was: https://extranet.atlassian.com/questions/2293501429/answers/2292192278#
fields.summary: Truncating and hiding answers after 100 answers have been provided.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48090].
  {panel}

Atlassian Answers has reputation-based permissions enabled, which grants additional features to users based on how much reputation they've earned.  Additionally, we also have some customizations in place that reward users with Atlassian merchandise at certain reputation levels.

When users begin to accrue over 1,000 reputation points, Confluence Questions displays an abbreviated value in their user profile for points earned.  I assume this was done to save on horizontal space used and because digits become less significant as the magnitude of points accrued increases.  Confluence Questions will round up or down to the nearest significant digit to to this.

Unfortunately this can be very confusing as a user when you're working towards a specific point level.  We give away a T-Shirt on Answers at 1,500 points, but the profile will display "1.5K" before the user has actually reached 1,500 points.  

To avoid this confusion, the rounding algorithm should only ever round down. "1,499" points should display as "1.4k", not "1.5k".
fields.summary: Rounding up reputation scores makes people think that they have reached permission or reward levels prematurely

  {panel}

If I try to access answers.atlassian.com while logged in with my Atlassian ID I am redirected to this URL: https://id.atlassian.com/profile/linkAccount.action?application=acac&continue=https%3a%2f%2fanswers%2eatlassian%2ecom%2f

And get a generic error - "An error occurred while attempting to fulfil your request"

I wasn't getting any account linking notifications prior to the change to CQ, and I can log in to all other Atlassian sites I have tried without any issues. If I log out on another site and then attempt to access Answers I also don't have any issues until I log in.

This isn't urgent, but it's a bit annoying

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-48072].
  {panel}

We created a bot user account to run the migration script to Confluence Questions.

Some content ended up being set with the author as this bot, instead of the actual author.

See [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/users?username=migrationbot9001]

This is probably because the user who really added that content didn't get migrated due to some other error (see [CQ-1329]).

Once we solve [CQ-1329] we should fix up this content so it's associated with the correct user.  This will require some way to edit the author metadata associated with the content - this requirement will be handled by [CQ-1281].
fields.summary: Some questions, answers and comments are linked to the "migration bot" user

fields.description:
The administrator of a space and of Confluence (not site administrator) is unable to edit other users answers if the question is associated with a space. This will happen even though the user has all permissions in that space.

This is when Reputation Based Permissions is off.

The strange part is that the same user can edit other users answers if the question is not associated with a space.

The user gets this error:
!permission_error.png|thumbnail!

It reads:
{panel}
Not Permitted
You are not permitted to perform this operation.
{panel}

The [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/QUESTIONS/Permissions] doesn't really say who should be able to edit other users's answer when Reputation Based Permissions is off, but since the administrator can edit when a question is not associated to a space, it seems logic that (s)he should be able to edit it when associated to a space where (s)he has all permissions.

Confluence version is 5.7-OD-44, CQ version is 2.0.10.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a user (administrator in Confluence, but not site administrator)
# Create a space where the user has all permissions
# Have Reputation Based Permissions off
# Create question A outside of spaces
# Create question B inside the space that was created
# Have another user comment on both issues

*Expected behavior*
* Administrator is able to edit the comment on both questions

*Actual behavior*
* Administrator can edit the comment on A but not on B
fields.summary: Administrator is unable to edit other users permission if question is associated with space
